attributes.action: Require cases of controlling & coercive behaviour to be heard by trained judges
attributes.background: The standard jury system cannot understand or deal appropriately with perpetrators of psychological abuse. These cases must be exempt from a jury and heard by a judge with specialist psychology level trained to understand narcistic traits of controlling and coercive behaviour in all relationships.
attributes.additional_details: This crime is mind torture as the perpetrator isolates and abuses their victim to the extreme in a calculated way so they are trapped completely. This is not seen by anyone and the evidence is minimal for conviction with a public jury. Perpetrators will not leave their victims alone. They cover up so well and you are made to look crazy. You get Stockholm syndrome, PTSD and ill. However many times you flee, they can find you, they know exactly what they are doing.

attributes.action: Stop/ reduce the financial requirement in immigration -It's breaking up families
attributes.background: Financial requirements are too high and minimum wage is too low. Lower the financial criteria to minimum wage or get rid of it. Families are being broken by the Home Office as they are deporting genuine family members out of the UK and creating skype families.
attributes.additional_details: You need to earn £18,600 for a spouse visa. When there's a child involved and the member of the family has no working rights, the financial criteria is impossible to reach. It’s destroying lives and making people mentally ill.

attributes.action: The UK government should allow Steve Bannon to enter the UK
attributes.background: Steve Bannon is not a far-right political figure he is just plain and simple Right.  To say he poses a risk to the security of the UK is absurd. He should be allowed to enter the UK and give a strong alternative view to the liberal left we have here.

attributes.action: Make sanitary products free for all women
attributes.background: Why should women pay for a something they can't control?
attributes.additional_details: There are women and children missing days at school and work coz they can't afford products to keep them clean.

attributes.action: Pressure the Chinese government remove the reverse ban on rhinos and tiger trade
attributes.background: The Chinese government has decided to reverse their 25 year ban on the trade of rhinos and tigers.
attributes.additional_details: Only 30,000 rhinos and 3,900 tigers remain in the wild. Their extinction will be accelerated without the ban. there is an old tradition which believes that tiger and rhino bones have medical healing powers which have been proven false.

attributes.action: Ban plastic toys from being included with children's magazines
attributes.background: Publishers are unlikely to stop doing this unless there is some kind of universal agreement for all to stop at a given time in the future.
attributes.additional_details: The magazines are great, educational, and kids love them. The toys are merely to encourage favour of one magazine over another. They are also cheaply made and break quickly.  This is creating a significant amount of pollution (something that our children will not thank us for in years to come).  Adding the toys also takes advantage of children's susceptibility to advertising.

attributes.action: Stop HMRC from referring to the UK taxpayers as their "customers"
attributes.background: HMRC, in all their publications as well as communications to individuals refers to us, the body of the Great British tax payer as "customers". This is not only misleading, but an outright mockery given the absence of choice over who and what you as a "customer" deal with.
attributes.additional_details: A customer is an individual or business that purchases the goods or services produced by a business. Attracting customers is the primary goal of most public-facing businesses, because it is the customer who creates demand for goods and services." The UK taxpayer does not create a demand for HMRC, nor do we have a choice or any consumer rights when it comes to dealing with HMRC. Therefore, HMRC must revert to using the term "taxpayer" in all their publications and communications.

attributes.action: Only allow public use of Fireworks on select dates
attributes.background: Almost all animals suffer from the loud bangs from fireworks & can cause them to have health problems. As well as that, fireworks can cause stress to PTSD sufferers & people who generally have a fear of them.
attributes.additional_details: Only allowing public use of fireworks on select dates (for example, Bonfire night, New Years Eve & Chinese New Year) would really help for animals & people who suffer from the fireworks. It would mean they have time to plan & be more calm & on other nights when it’s professional displays only, people will know when the fireworks will go off & when they will stop, so it’s not much of a fright.

attributes.action: Offer a catchup HPV vaccine programme to women aged 18-26 on the NHS
attributes.background:
- Many women missed the HPV vaccine while at school due to parental abstention or missed appointments.
- The HPV vaccine is currently only available to women on the NHS up until age 18
- The vaccine retails at £450 at high-street pharmacies - utterly unaffordable for most.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS vaccine guidelines - https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/vaccinations/hpv-human-papillomavirus-vaccine/

3100 cases of cervical cancer are diagnosed in the UK each year - almost ALL are related to HPV - https://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/cervical-cancer

It's utterly unacceptable that girls and women who were opted out by their parents while at school are unable to catch up when they hit the age of medical consent. Providing the vaccine as a catchup will save lives, and save NHS money.

attributes.action: Build animal bridges over country roads to stop them being killed in the 1000's
attributes.background: Living in the countryside it breaks my heart to see dead birds, deer, foxes, rabbits and badgers dead on the road. Animals just trying to live in a world that we have added thousands of cars to. They are being punished by humans. We already rule the world. Save the wildlife while there's time
attributes.additional_details: A65 is a prime example of this in Cumbria. Every single day there is a dead animal on this road. And most other roads around these parts. It's disgusting how we destroy every we touch let alone what we are doing to the animals. Finding a half dead mangled deer at the side of the road and having to put it out of its misery is the worst thing I've had to do and it's not the first one. Please get on board

attributes.action: A pre-biopsy MRI prostate assessment should be offered all men with elevated PSA
attributes.background: A pre-biopsy MRI assessment with contrast agent can detect prostate cancer not detected by the PSA test. All men with symptoms consistent with prostate cancer should be offered an MRI assessment within four weeks by their GP. This will aid early diagnosis improving patient outcome.
attributes.additional_details:
Practical Barriers to Obtaining Pre-Biopsy Prostate MRI: Assessment in over 1,500 Consecutive Men Undergoing Prostate Biopsy in a Single Urologic Practice 
A.B. Rosenkrantz 
ISSN: 0042-1138 , 1423-0399; DOI: 10.1159/000446003 
Urologia internationalis. , 2016, Vol.97(2), p.247-248

Prostate MRI Can Reduce Overdiagnosis and Overtreatment of Prostate Cancer 
A.B. Rosenkrantz 
ISSN: 1076-6332; DOI: 10.1016/j.acra.2015.02.006 
Academic Radiology , 2015, Vol.22(8), p.1000-1006

attributes.action: Constitution to prevent ceding sovereignty to foreign powers without referendum
attributes.background:
In signing the European Communities Bill in 1972 thus taking us into the EEC without our consent, Edward Heath sacrificed our independence. Thus making the articles on the supremacy of British Parliament only of historical perspective.
He should've had referendum 1st on such constitutional change
attributes.additional_details:
In enacting the European Communities Bill through an ordinary vote in the House of Commons, Heath's Government breached the constitutional convention which requires a prior consultation of the people (either by a general election or a referendum) on any measure involving constitutional change. 
We need a constitution that is not merely convention, but that is actually written into our law to prevent this happening again.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate withdrawal of British support for Iran Nuclear deal.
attributes.background: On May 1st, BBC reported US response to Israel's claim of secret Iranian nuclear weapons factory hidden in Northern Syria, with the goal of producing 5 nuclear warheads. Israel presented evidence to show that Iran lied and defrauded the deal. http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-43958205
attributes.additional_details: The Iran deal has produced great international controversy since its signature in 2015. To many, the very idea of bribing a terrorist-supporting state not to produce nuclear weapons has always been a dangerous nonsense. The British government talked a big talk against Russia with the Skripal poisoning, but seems completely blind to Iran's recklessly dangerous actions. This double standard needs be justified with full public parliamentary debate about withdrawing from the Iran deal.

attributes.action: Regulate the beauty & Aesthetics Industry to protect Non medics & the public
attributes.background: For a while now there has been a need for change and regulation within the beauty & aesthetics industry, but now more than ever we need to put in place a regulated UK body for Non medics alongside proper regulated qualifications that will allow non medics the correct recognised training
attributes.additional_details:
The UK beauty & aesthetics industry has many correctly trained and knowledgeable non medics providing aesthetics safely, however in the past few months this has been brought under scrutiny by medics and whilst many of the claims aimed at non medics are very unjust, it has  highlighted to many that the aesthetics & beauty industry as a whole needs to change.
The industry needs to be correctly & fairly regulated to protect not only the public but also protect non medics, their careers and futures!

attributes.action: Make the nit nurse mandatory in schools to remedy this increasing infection rate
attributes.background: Checking for and treating nits are now the parents responsibility. With the absence of the nit nurse, nits are now rife, especially within primary schools.
attributes.additional_details:
Nits are getting immune to treatments and the removal process is not only traumatising for children with longer hair, its time consuming and expensive. For these reasons, unfortunately, some children go left untreated and the epidemic continues. 

Petitions have been tried before and failed and I can’t understand why. People you speak to, social media posts -nits are a huge problem within our schools. We need to re-instate the nit nurse and once again, get control over this unhygienic, distressing situation.

attributes.action: Reinstate the annual Royal Tournament
attributes.background:
The Royal Tournament was the world's largest military tattoo and pageant, held by the British Armed Forces annually between 1880 and 1999.
A celebration of the British Armed Forces, and promoting the UK globally, it is the ideal annual event to promote support for the British Armed Forces.
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Tournament provides many benefits to the UK, showcasing the UK military as well as in terms of services charitable awareness, retention of personnel and as a much needed recruitment tool for our armed services.

attributes.action: Reduce the TV license fee and privatise the BBC
attributes.background:
The BBC was created as a government funded TV channel when there were very few other options. Today, with hundreds of alternative channels, the BBC is not needed.

The TV license should ONLY be for maintenance of broadcasting equipment, and the BBC should be self funded like all other TV channels.
attributes.additional_details:
Our proposal is to make the BBC a privately funded channel, as all others are, with commercials and/or subscription fees. Approximately 11% of license fees are spent on the infrastructure and broadcasting equipment, the rest is spent on BBC programming and administation,  and chasing license fees. 

By making the BBC private, more people will be able to watch live TV without having to pay a hefty fee for a service they don't use.

attributes.action: Give English constituencies a referendum on creating an English Parliament
attributes.background: Voters in English constituencies want the creation of a secular single chamber English Parliament elected separately from Westminster and located outside of London. This will address the democratic deficit experienced by English voters and give us English votes for English laws.

attributes.action: To require pharmacies to have Epipens (and other AAIs) in store at all times.
attributes.background: When my son tried his first ever peanut within seconds he began vomiting, coughing and broke out into hives. My son could have died. It is only an epipen that could save his life if ever he was to go into anaphylactic shock. Not having an Epipen readily available in pharmacies is endangering lives.
attributes.additional_details: The problem with an allergy is you never know how serious it is going to be. Sometimes my son may just vomit, or his lips will swell. One day his tongue may swell so much that his airway is blocked so he can’t breath. With an Epipen the adrenaline would act instantly and save my son’s life. If insufficient Epipens (and other AAIs) are being manufactured and stocked my son might not have one to save his life! Please ensure this life saving medicine is readily available in our pharmacies.

attributes.action: Save the NHS with a 1p in the pound increase in income tax/national insurance.
attributes.background: Our NHS is in crisis. Funding, although somewhat increased, has been outstripped by a need for additional services. With a 1p rise we could gain approx 11bn funding. We are lucky to get healthcare free at point of use. The equivalent private or insurance cost would exceed the tax increase
attributes.additional_details: https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/politics/gordon-brown-says-1p-tax-12647021

attributes.action: Make Mobility allowance available from birth on need, remove age discrimination.
attributes.background: Mobility allowance is only available to people over the age of 3, over  two thousand children under the age of 3 are required to have bulky medical equipment or specialised support wheelchairs, and as such are at risk when travelling in unsuitable or potentially unsafe vehicles  for their needs.
attributes.additional_details: The government wants children under three to go to a charity to get funding for a Wheelchair Accessible Vehicle, this is discriminating against them on the grounds of age, and goes against the governments own policy published on 1 October 2012 that outlaws discrimination based on age, the requirement for a Wheelchair Accessible Vehicle should be base wholly on the need of the child and age should not be a qualifying factor, these children can effectively become housebound because of this policy.

attributes.action: Stop NHS patients being weighed in public waiting rooms and corridors.
attributes.background: In NHS hospital departments, patients are weighed in a public waiting rooms within sight and earshot of other patients and visitors. The NHS must provide dignity for patients.
attributes.additional_details: This is humiliating for patients, especially those who may have experienced weight difficulties, insecurities around body image, mental health issues etc.

attributes.action: Enact an Environmental Law
attributes.background: Since the BBC 1 broadcasting of the Blue Planet (Oceans) showing the harm caused to marine life by plastic packaging there has been a public outcry.
attributes.additional_details:
Supermarket chains should be compelled (by law) to publish on their web sites their use of three categories of plastic packaging.

1) Single Use Plastic 
2) Recyclable Plastic 
3) 100% biodegradable plastic 

And all as a percentage of their total plastic packaging. - Doing this would enable consumers to make choices as to where they shop, and what purchases they make not just on price but additionally and importantly on environmental sustainability.

attributes.action: Bring a proposal to the UN for world multilateral disarmament.
attributes.background: Arms companies spread weapons worldwide that produce wars, destruction, death, poverty and global warming.
attributes.additional_details:
World Disarmament ends this failure; disarmed countries do not fight. It can be done if the military are not in charge of the process - turkeys don't vote for Christmas. It is world transforming.

The proposal to the UN should be that: 
1. Each state cuts military expenditure and arms by 10% a year for a decade. 
2. All arms production and selling stops. Arms firms have 5 year falling state subsidy while they refocus their business. 
3. The UN has a (reducing) armed force to clear out terrorist and other armed groups. 
4. The UN and all nations police these policies with open access to all military systems. 
5. UN Courts decide issues of injustice, infringement of disarmament and international disputes.

attributes.action: Issue 5-year work visa to non-EU nurses and doctors coming to work for the NHS
attributes.background: Issuing a 5-year work visa to non EU nurses & doctors will help staff retention. After 5 years, they can apply for a resident permit & settle in UK. This will encourage nurses & doctors to continue working for their first NHS Trust visa sponsor instead of moving to another Trust or worst leave UK.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/jul/26/nhs-in-england-facing-deepening-staffing-crisis-figures-show

http://workpermit.com/immigration/usa/permanent-us-residence-nurses

attributes.action: Call for government to end the Badger Cull in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: The scientific evidence demonstrates that culling is ineffective in fighting the disease and, worse still, risks making the problem even worse. We believe the emphasis of all our efforts should be to find a long-term solution and we are calling for the Government to end its policy,
attributes.additional_details: The Badger Cull is not only not working to protect Cattle and Dairy Herds but is causing very dangerous situations around the country where hired Marksmen are shooting and sometimes trapping badgers. The real victims are the badgers please sign the petition to stop the cull.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for under 25's so it is equal and fair for all
attributes.background: For people who are aged 25 and over the minimum wage is £7.83 in 2018 yet if you are below the age of 25, even if just by one year, then you are entitled to less. The younger you are the less money you get. Same job, same hours but someone is going to be paid less based on their age.
attributes.additional_details: As said previously a person aged 25 and over will be paid £7.83p/h, a 21 to 24 year old will be paid £7.38 an hour. If aged between 18 and 20 you will receive £5.90p/h and finally, if you are a school leaver or in college under the age of 18 you will only recieve £4.20. The cost of living does not depend on your age so why should your wages? This is a form of discrimination which needs to change so everyone can have a good start in life but a majority of companies play by these guidelines.

attributes.action: Reconsider the changes made to A-levels in respect to the amount of content.
attributes.background: New A-level changes have too much information content that needs to be taught, This is contributing to a student mental health crisis and is not allowing teacher to focus on development of expression, analysis and evaluation, essential skills required for student's future endeavours.

attributes.action: To strip of Govia of its franchises (Southern,Thameslink,Gt Northern & GX)
attributes.background: Following years of poor services across the Southern Railway, Thameslink, Gatwick Express & Gt. Northern rail network we call upon Parliament & DfT to consider the return of these services to public sector operation as done with the East Coast Line which has proven financial record in public hands
attributes.additional_details: The reliability of the service provided by Govia has been steadily deteriorating for years & now with the latest timetable shake up has seen journey times extended, more connections, mass train delays & cancellations. When the ECL was last in public ownership it generated money (£1b) for reinvestment services something that could help Govia passengers get the service they deserve. https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2014/nov/27/privatising-east-coast-rail-rip-off?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other

attributes.action: Ban cold calling at people’s homes
attributes.background: A neighbour was brutally attacked and murdered in her own home after answering the door to her assailant. It’s common knowledge that conmen use cold calling to steal from vulnerable people and gain access to homes often leading to devastating consequences.
attributes.additional_details: People should not be allowed to sell goods or services door-to-door without an invitation. We need to ban cold calling to protect the elderly and vulnerable by cutting off access for the cruel people that use this as a means of access. Most people now will go online to source builders, windows etc and look for reviews of companies. We do not need people knocking on our homes leaving some scared and open to being subjecting to robberies, fraud and being harmed.

attributes.action: Make LGV & PSV drivers pass a UK driving test before working in the UK
attributes.background: Make all non-UK lgv and psv drivers pass a UK driving test before working within UK for more than a month. I drive LGV and passed a UK test many years ago. I know of companies that employ lots of non UK drivers, some have brought a licence without taking a test.
attributes.additional_details: Overseas drivers may not be familiar with UK roads. It could help stop accidents on UK roads if they took the test.

attributes.action: Urge USA not to cease funding UNWRA and contribute towards any shortfall
attributes.background:
The US decision further destabilises the Middle East and make the possibility of a peaceful solution more remote. It shows further partiality in favour of Israel following  moving its embassy to Jerusalem and increasing aid to Israel

UK should urge other countries to help making up the shortfall
attributes.additional_details:
UNWRA provides food aid and education to Palestinian refugees and this loss of funding will cause immense suffering and misery.
https://www.unrwa.org
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-45377336

attributes.action: Compulsory compensation by local authorities.
attributes.background: Following the introduction of the ULEZ coming into action in April 2019, millions of Londoners are being deprived of their valued possessions by the decision of the local authorities.
attributes.additional_details: Any implementation of new / change of regulation, imposed by any authority in the UK triggering the immediate devaluation of personal possessions of its constituents (e.g. the immediate depreciation of personal and commercial vehicles following the introduction of ULEZ) should be bound by law to a compulsory compensatory pay equal to the true and actual loss suffered to every individual or entity affected and deprived of the financial value of its possessions in the public interest.

attributes.action: Change vaping law to hold more than 2 ml of liquid in any device
attributes.background: Vapes were made to hold only 2ml of juice making people carry bottles with them all the time. You carry bottles around with you, it’s stupid and makes no sense.

attributes.action: Ensure MPs can scrutinise, amend and vote on any final Brexit deal
attributes.background: The British people voted in the referendum on our membership of the EU and our politicians must organise a coordinated withdrawal in the best interest of the nation. Our democratically elected representatives must not be stripped of the power to analyse and amend any deal before passing it into law.
attributes.additional_details: The future of our nation will be affected profoundly by leaving the EU. Our representatives in Parliament must be able to have a meaningful say and make binding amendments on the terms of the final Brexit proposals made by Government negotiators. To not do so undermines our democracy and silences parliament. A rushed ill considered “take it or leave it” vote would adversely affect our nation for generations.

attributes.action: Stop NHS sharing data with 3rd-party advertisers, analytics and social media
attributes.background: When you use NHS websites, you get tracked. The issue was raised in 2010 by MPs, but was not resolved. Instead, Facebook and other companies went on to get data for a further 7 years. NHS privacy policies say that there's tracking. Such 3rd parties should be barred from NHS websites and mobile apps.
attributes.additional_details: The combination of HTTP Referers, third party cookies and third party JavaScript, provide these parties with the ability to track users by their unique or user ids and identify pages visited. Furthermore, third party JavaScript allows them to change NHS page content as they see fit, access data on it or act as the user on pages. I've complained directly to the NHS, ICO and Ministers in the hope of getting this fixed, but it is still a serious problem.

attributes.action: Increase the Defence Budget to 3% of the GDP (Approx. £80bn/year) by 2025.
attributes.background:
Defence is an important subject.
The Armed Forces require a lot of money to be put towards them, as having the most professional military on the planet isn't cheap.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent budget cuts have had a severe effect on our Armed Forces. Thousands of jobs have been lost, and not enough people are joining.

Our Navy is ever decreasing in size, with barely enough ships to protect the new Queen Elizabeth class carriers, or even men to crew them.
Our Air Force lacks in the modern aircraft we need to defend our great nation.
The Army is in need of new land-systems all the time.

Our current Defence Budget just cannot afford it, especially how it's currently decreasing.

attributes.action: Put gynaecological health on the PSHE curriculum for girls aged 11-18
attributes.background: Endometriosis and polycystic ovary syndrome affect millions of girls and women nationwide but there is not any explanation to young women about the symptoms of such illnesses. Education on gynaecological health needs to be put on the curriculum so less women go through their young life in pain.

attributes.action: Make it the law for all schools to display their Anti Bullying Policy!
attributes.background:
A recent study has seen that 80% of teens were not aware their school had an anti-bullying policy. 
100% said they felt it would benefit if the policy was displayed on notice boards around the school. So let’s make it the law to have it displayed and not just on a website!!
attributes.additional_details:
This study was conducted on Chat2HelpAllTeenagers.co.uk from 30 teenagers across the UK. 
Why aren’t schools making all parents and children aware of the policy - as the government website indicates all parents and children should be told about it. 
This recent study highlights that this is not done, and feel we need to change this! 
 
So please help, sign this petition 
 
www.chat2helpallteenagers.co.uk

attributes.action: Ban single-use plastics.
attributes.background:
No matter your stance on the EU, to ban single-use plastics was a smart move and should be enforced by the UK.

In 2015, plastic packaging waste accounted for 47% of plastic waste. 2017 alone produced a total of 400 million tons of plastic waste. (Single-Use Plastics, UN Env. Programme '18)
attributes.additional_details:
Likewise, the deposit system for plastic bottles and tin/aluminium cans should be enforced to ensure the return of these items to locations where they can be recycled. Waste and waste sorting cost will therefore naturally diminish.

So:
- BAN single-use plastics*
- Introduce a nationwide deposit system for plastic/aluminium bottles/cans

* single-use pastics include straws, coffee stirrers, styrofoam take-away cups/containers, milk jugs, toiletry containers, and more.

Thanks for your attention.

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: To prohibit the sale of rat poison to non-professionals
attributes.background: People are baiting dog treats and or leaving large quantities of it in parks and open spaces to kill off animals. I have had one dog recently die and another even more recently digest a large quantity and is lucky to be alive. Luckily we rushed him straight to the vets and he is now home safe.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theargus.co.uk/news/16860293.family-devastated-as-rat-poison-kills-one-dog-and-almost-kills-another/

attributes.action: Re-introduce National Service
attributes.background: For the good of the country and it’s people, bring back National Service.

attributes.action: Introduce ‘Dental Hygiene in pregnancy’ booklets to 12 week antenatal checkups
attributes.background:
I feel like we are being let down in terms of proactive dental hygiene education for pregnant women.
 I believe thousands of women are having to undergo dental work postpartum as they were not aware of the significant affect that changes in hormones during pregnancy can have on their teeth.
attributes.additional_details:
I am aware that the NHS provides free dental care to pregnant women & for up to one year post partum but I feel that more should be done proactively in order to stop new mums having to go through painful/intrusive dental treatment. 

Advice regarding additional brushing after certain foods, not brushing immediately after bouts of morning sickness, additional visits to the hygienist, increasing calcium & vitamin D 

Ensuring that both midwives & dentists educate pregnant women of additional risks

attributes.action: Require UK fashion retailers to sign up to an environmental code of ethics
attributes.background:
Companies trading in the UK should be required to source clothes responsibly.
 
To feed a culture of cheap fashion, companies are ignoring the environmental damage in developing countries.
 
Fashion is the 2nd largest global polluter. The UK is one of the largest consumers of fashion.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC production: Stacey Dooley Investigates Fashion's Dirty Secret. 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/bbcthree/article/5a1a43b5-cbae-4a42-8271-48f53b63bd07

attributes.action: Ban vaping in public places
attributes.background: Not enough is known about vaping and its long-term health effects. The Government shouldn’t allow vaping in public places such as public transport. Let’s protect our children and treat it as a potential health problem of the future.
attributes.additional_details:
This article says that there are potential health issues with vaping and more needs to be learnt. Let’s protect ourselves and future generations now. 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/science/2018/jan/29/vaping-may-raise-cancer-and-heart-disease-risk-study-suggests

attributes.action: Ban TV adverts of  gambling sites and betting firms sponsoring football shirts.
attributes.background:
Gambling addictions are costing the country £1.2bn.
The increasing relationship between football and gambling is normalising gambling  and influencing our vulnerable children and young people. 24/7 access to online betting via smart phones will soon cause a national epidemic. It needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Although not involving a chemical like an addiction to smoking, alcohol or drugs the problem or compulsive gambler is just as much an  addict. They will have financial and relationship problems. They could end up in prison or even committing suicide - suggested rates being 20%.
In 1965 the British Government banned tobacco advertising and in 2005 banned sponsorship of global events.
They need to do the same with gambling and betting firm sponsorships before more lives are ruined.

attributes.action: Raise the age of sale, of fireworks, to the general public from 18 to 25.
attributes.background: All year round this is an issue but it becomes more apparent in the winter months. Irresponsible youths are allowed to purchase fireworks and they have no regard for the safety of others. Fireworks are meant to be fun but in the wrong hands they soon become weapons.
attributes.additional_details: I have already read so many public posts, by people who have already been affected by youths setting off fireworks in public places, about people whose pets suffer huge distress, let alone non domestic wildlife. If fireworks must be sold to the public it needs to be regulated better.

attributes.action:
Introduce a national day called 
National Ability Day.
attributes.background: People with disabilities are often overlooked, having a National Ability Day will show the country what people with disabilities can do than what we can’t.

attributes.action: Increase firefighters pay!
attributes.background:
My dad is a firefighter and has been amongst the many heroes tackling the fires on the moors/winter hill.
There is such a positive response from the public recognising the gruelling work they do its just a shame their wages don't reflect this with their pay frozen & capped at 1% It needs to change!
attributes.additional_details:
Firefighters pay has been frozen and capped at 1% with inflation rising at around 3%. With their pension and national insurance contributions rising their wages have in effect dropped! 
These heroes risk their lives every day not only putting out fires but doing so much more than you could imagine and they deserve / need to have the cap lifted and their pay increased. Lets give something back to them and help get this changed!
